title: NFL Season & Playoff Structure
subtitle: From September to Super Bowl Sunday
description: Learn how the football season works and how teams make the playoffs

What you'll learn: Which 14 teams make the playoffs (and how)
The path from Wild Card to Super Bowl

sections.title: The football Year
sections.content: The football season is more than just games - it's a journey from August to February with regular season, playoffs, and the Super Bowl.

sections.title: Regular Season Structure
sections.content: Each football team plays 17 regular season games over 18 weeks, with one bye week for rest.
details: 32 teams divided into 2 conferences (AFC and NFC)
Each conference has 4 divisions with 4 teams each
Teams play 17 games from September to January
Games are mostly on Sundays, with some Thursday and Monday games

sections.title: How Teams Make the Playoffs
sections.content: Only 14 of the 32 football teams make the playoffs - 7 from each conference based on their regular season record.
details: 4 division winners automatically qualify
3 'wild card' teams with best records among non-winners
Teams are seeded 1-7 based on record and tiebreakers
Higher seeds get home field advantage

sections.title: Playoff Format
sections.content: The playoffs are single elimination - lose and you're out! It's a 4-round tournament leading to the Super Bowl.
details: Wild Card Round: Seeds 2-7 play (1 seed gets bye)
Divisional Round: Winners vs top seeds
Conference Championships: AFC and NFC title games
Super Bowl: AFC champion vs NFC champion

sections.title: The Super Bowl
sections.content: The Super Bowl is the football championship game - the biggest sporting event in America held on the first Sunday in February.
details: Most watched TV event of the year
Held at a neutral site chosen years in advance
Winner gets the Lombardi Trophy
Features elaborate halftime show and expensive commercials

sections.title: Draft and Offseason
sections.content: After the Super Bowl, teams prepare for next season with the football Draft, free agency, and training camp.
details: football Draft: Teams select college players (7 rounds)
Free Agency: Players can sign with new teams
Training Camp: Teams practice and cut to final roster
Preseason: Practice games before regular season

sections.title: The Complete football Experience
sections.content: The football season is a year-long cycle of competition, with the ultimate goal being a Super Bowl championship.
keyTakeaways: 17 regular season games determine playoff seeding
Single elimination playoffs lead to Super Bowl
Season runs from September to February

questions.question: How many regular season games does each football team play?
questions.explanation: Each football team plays 17 regular season games over 18 weeks (with one bye week).

questions.question: How many teams from each conference make the playoffs?
questions.explanation: 7 teams from each conference (AFC and NFC) make the playoffs, for a total of 14 playoff teams.

questions.question: What type of tournament are the football playoffs?
questions.explanation: football playoffs are single elimination - if you lose one game, your season is over.

questions.question: When is the Super Bowl typically played?
questions.explanation: The Super Bowl is played on the first Sunday in February each year.
